item.title: Gold Edges Higher After U.S. Job Creation Slowed
item.description: Gold prices rose after U.S. jobs data showed private payrolls growth was less than expected in November. Futures are trading 0.4% higher at $2,679.50 ...

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Fall More Than Expected
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories fell more than expected last week and product stocks saw a buildup as refineries ramped up their capacity use.

item.title: Dollar Might Rise But Not in a Straight Line
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index is little changed but the dollar is likely to strengthen in 2025. It might face a period of weakness early in the year, Standard ...

item.title: SEC, States Investigate Firm Holding Couple's $763,094 Retirement Fund
item.description: The probes focus on Next Level Holdings and Yield Wealth, which offered investors the promise of double-digit returns.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Gain, Led by Tech Shares
item.description: The Nasdaq Composite led U.S. stock indexes higher after a batch of better-than-expected tech earnings.
